pr_title: Add Shadow Stack support for a simple app
pr_body:
<!--

Thank you for opening a new PR to the Unikraft Open Source Project!  We welcome
new changes, features, fixes, and more!  Please fill in this form to indicate
the status of your PR.  Please ensure you have read the contribution guidelines
before opening a new PR as this will cover the PR process:

  https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/

-->

### Prerequisite checklist

<!--
Please mark items appropriately:
-->

 - [x] Read the [contribution guidelines](https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/) regarding submitting new changes to the project;
 - [x] Tested your changes against relevant architectures and platforms;
 - [ ] Ran the [`checkpatch.pl`](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/support/scripts/checkpatch.pl) on your commit series before opening this PR;
 - [ ] Updated relevant documentation.


### Base target

 - Architecture(s): `AArch64`
 - Platform(s): `KVM`
 - Application(s): N/A


### Additional configuration

<!--
Please specify any additional configuration which is needed for this feature to
work or any new configuration parameters which are introduced by this PR.  This
will help during the review process.  For example:

 - `CONFIG_LIBUKDEBUG=y`

-->

You'll need to update the `Makefile.uk` of your app by adding this (let our app be `helloworld` for the sake of simplicity)
```
APPHELLOWORLD_CINCLUDES-y += -fsanitize=shadow-call-stack -ffixed-x18 -fno-exceptions
COMPFLAGS-y += -ffixed-x18 -fno-exceptions
```

Shadow Stack support comes with `clang` as a compiler, you'll have to build the app accordingly.

Build using
```
make CC=clang LD=~/toolchains/gcc-arm-11.2-2022.02-x86_64-aarch64-none-elf/bin/aarch64-none-elf-gcc OBJCOPY=~/toolchains/gcc-arm-11.2-2022.02-x86_64-aarch64-none-elf/bin/aarch64-none-elf-objcopy STRIP=~/toolchains/gcc-arm-11.2-2022.02-x86_64-aarch64-none-elf/bin/aarch64-none-elf-strip
```

You'll need the gcc cross-compiling toolchain installed. Get it from [here](https://developer.arm.com/tools-and-software/open-source-software/developer-tools/gnu-toolchain/downloads).

Also, make sure to have erratum options disabled when using `menuconfig` (`Architecture Selection` -> `Arm8 Compatible` -> `Workaround for [...] erratum`).

What's more, you'll have to configure the `Custom cross-compiler LLVM target` too (`Build Options` -> `Custom cross-compiler LLVM target`); just write `aarch64-none-elf` and you should be good to go.



### Description of changes

<!--
Please provide a detailed description of the changes made in this new PR.
-->

This PR aims to demonstrate how the Shadow Stack support will behave.

It brings minor changes in order to make possible the compilation with `clang`, as this security mechanism is supported by `clang` and `gcc-12`.

Further changes were made in `boot.c` in order to initialize the Shadow Stack.

Future changes will bring better performance by changing the memory allocator to a Unikraft based one and by integrating the constructor in the Unikraft constructor table.

For Proof of Concept and other information, refer [this](https://github.com/mariasfiraiala/scs-work/blob/master/unikraft-scs/unikraft-scs-for-helloworld.md).

                        -device virtio-9p-pci,fsdev=myid,mount_tag=fs0,disable-modern=on,disable-legacy=off \

If #10 is merged, `kraft` will use the default `fs0` mount tag.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 16, 0, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1018128656, 'comment_body': 'We should also specify that the mount tag must be `fs0` if the users will want to use `kraft` or `qemu-guest`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 16, 1, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1018153234, 'comment_body': "Agree with @StefanJum

Please use the new updated branch, see @StefanJum 's comments, mark conversations solved by clicking `Resolve conversation` (once they are solved) and re-request his review.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 16, 21, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'razvand', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1018267568, 'comment_body': '```suggestion

Please use one line per sentence and one sentence per line.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 18, 12, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1018285471, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
This is due to how the `qemu-guest` script and kraft automatically tag the FS devices attached to `qemu`.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 18, 31, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1018287798, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
If you are going to use the `qemu-guest` script or `kraft` to launch the app, you need to name the `Default root device` `fs0` (`Library Configuration` -> `vfscore` -> `Default root device`).
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 11, 9, 18, 34, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: include: Fix macros in order to facilitate running apps on `AArch64`
pr_body:
This PR fixes multiple issues regarding `newlib` support on `AArch64`.

Signed-off-by: Maria Sfiraiala <maria.sfiraiala@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Eduard Vintilă <eduard.vintila47@gmail.com>
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 937981310, 'comment_body': "This should actually happen for all architectures. [This commit](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-newlib/commit/58f9f3a3f7b5ca9c5f0c7c095e067abba29f5ed6) made the change for ARM, but it should happen for all architectures. `nolibc` defines the same value for both [x86_64](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/lib/nolibc/arch/x86_64/bits/fcntl.h) and for [ARM](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/lib/nolibc/arch/arm64/bits/fcntl.h). So, the two lines above should go both for x86_64 and for ARM. I think it's cleanest to duplicate them for each architectural `#ifdef`, connected to the other macros:

```
#undef FNONBLOCK
#undef O_NONBLOCK
#define FNONBLOCK 04000
#define O_NONBLOCK FNONBLOCK
```

I validated this working on my side.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 4, 16, 2, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'razvand', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1001606768, 'comment_body': 'Please note that `O_DIRECTORY` is a flag and should be only a single bit set. The value `0123456` is setting too many bits (see binary representation).', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 21, 9, 58, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'skuenzer', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Signed-off-by: Maria Sfiraiala <maria.sfiraiala@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Eduard Vintilă  <eduard.vintila47@gmail.com>
<!--

Thank you for opening a new PR to the Unikraft Open Source Project!  We welcome
new changes, features, fixes, and more!  Please fill in this form to indicate
the status of your PR.  Please ensure you have read the contribution guidelines
before opening a new PR as this will cover the PR process:

  https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/

-->

### Prerequisite checklist

<!--
Please mark items appropriately:
-->

 - [x] Read the [contribution guidelines](https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/) regarding submitting new changes to the project;
 - [x] Tested your changes against relevant architectures and platforms;
 - [ ] Ran the [`checkpatch.pl`](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/support/scripts/checkpatch.pl) on your commit series before opening this PR;
 - [ ] Updated relevant documentation.


### Base target

 - Architecture(s): `AArch64`
 - Platform(s): `kvm`
 - Application(s): `SQLite`, `nginx`


### Description of changes

<!--
Please provide a detailed description of the changes made in this new PR.
-->
This PR removes `__uk_tls` from `static __uk_tls struct passwd_entry` and `static __uk_tls struct group_entry` in order to facilitate running complex apps on `AArch64`.

Considering the fact that `TLS` isn't completely implemented for `AArch64` and the fact that the standard POSIX doesn't require the functions that use `static __uk_tls struct passwd_entry` and `static __uk_tls struct group_entry` to be multithreading safe, the changes made by this PR shouldn't affect anything more that running the aforementioned apps on the desired architecture.

pr_title: Remove redundant argument from POSIX_SOCKET_FAMILY_REGISTER macro
lib/posix-socket: Align posix_socket_driver to 8 bytes in binary
pr_body:
Instances of the `posix_socket_driver` structure (on for each socket family) are expected to be consecutive in the memory layout. By default, they are not.

This commit fixes it by aligning the structure to 8 bytes. This ensures structure instances are consecutively placed in the resulting binary (and then when loaded in memory).

pr_body: `mprotect()` is required and it is part of the `ukmmap` internal Unikraft library. Add required dependency to `Config.uk`.

pr_title: Config.uk: Add dependencies for POSIX libraries
pr_body:
Release 0.10 added `posix-socket` and `posix-event` internal aries to the Unikraft core. Consequently, libraries depending on orking functionality need to be updated to include `posix-socket` and `posix-event`.

This commit adds `LIBPOSIX_SOCKET` and `LIBPOSIX_EVENT` dependency `Config.uk`.

Fix #5

pr_title: Config.uk: Add dependencies for POSIX libraries
pr_body:
Release 0.10 added `posix-socket` and `posix-event` internal libraries to the Unikraft core. Consequently, libraries depending on networking functionality need to be updated to include `posix-socket` and
`posix-event`.

This commit adds `LIBPOSIX_SOCKET` and `LIBPOSIX_EVENT` dependency to `Config.uk`.

<!--

Thank you for opening a new PR to the Unikraft Open Source Project!  We welcome
new changes, features, fixes, and more!  Please fill in this form to indicate
the status of your PR.  Please ensure you have read the contribution guidelines
before opening a new PR as this will cover the PR process:

  https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/

-->

### Prerequisite checklist

<!--
Please mark items appropriately:
-->

 - [x] Read the [contribution guidelines](https://unikraft.org/docs/contributing/) regarding submitting new changes to the project;
 - [x] Tested your changes against relevant architectures and platforms;
 - [x] Ran the [`checkpatch.pl`](https://github.com/unikraft/unikraft/blob/staging/support/scripts/checkpatch.pl) on your commit series before opening this PR;
 - [ ] Updated relevant documentation.


### Base target

 - Architecture(s): [`x86_64`]
 - Platform(s): [`kvm`]
 - Application(s): [N/A]


### Additional configuration

<!--
Please specify any additional configuration which is needed for this feature to
work or any new configuration parameters which are introduced by this PR.  This
will help during the review process.  For example:

 - `CONFIG_LIBUKDEBUG=y`

-->

### Description of changes

The compiler expects the stack to be always 16-byte aligned and ending on `...8` when entering a function due to the call having pushed the return address. So the `pushq` in the prolog of the callee restores 16-byte alignment. However, at the moment we do not enforce any particular alignment for the boot stack. This can be a problem when the compiler uses instructions with alignment restrictions like `movaps`.

This commit enforces the required alignment.

pr_body:
Update the contents of sessions/complex-applications.

Fix broken links created by the sessions migration, add more
information into the session content, delete unused pics.

Signed-off-by: Maria Sfiraiala <maria.sfiraiala@gmail.com>
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 958262821, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The SQLite application is built using an external library, [lib-sqlite](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-sqlite), that depends on two other libraries that are ported for Unikraft: [pthread-embedded](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-pthread-embedded) (a lightweight implementation of POSIX Threads) and [newlib](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-newlib) (a standard C library).
```
Just a bit of info on `lib-pthread-embedded` and `lib-newlib`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 48, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958263979, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
* `Makefile`: containing rules for building the application, as well as specifying the libraries that the application needs
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 50, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958264560, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
```Makefile
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 50, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958264894, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
```Makefile
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 51, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958268556, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
As we are going to use the qemu wrapper to launch the app, we'll need to name the `Default root device` `fs0` (`Library Configuration` -> `vfscore` -> `Default root device`). This is due to how the `qemu-guest` script automatically tags the FS devices attached to qemu.
```

Maybe we can add a quick explanation why this is the case?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 54, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958268973, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![9pfs options](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/9pfs_options.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 55, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958269596, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![virtio options](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/virtio_options.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 55, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958273118, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Find the support files in the `work/02-change-filesystem-sqlite/` folder of the session directory. Make sure to create the `Makefile` and `Makefile.uk` files in a similar manner as with the previous work item before proceeding in configuring the application.
```
Add a reminder to students that they should create these two files?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 58, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958273910, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![filesystems menu](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/filesystems.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 9, 58, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958276217, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The InitRD filesystem can load only [cpio archives](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/zos/2.2.0?topic=formats-cpio-format-cpio-archives). In order to load our SQLite script into InitRD, we need to create a cpio out of it.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 1, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958276683, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
This can be achieved in the following way:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 1, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958281694, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Next, we run the following `qemu-guest` command to run the instance:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 6, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958282355, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
[Redis](https://redis.io/topics/introduction) is one of the most popular key-value databases, with a design that facilitates the fast writing and reading of data from memory, as well as the storage of data on disk in order to be able to reconstruct the state of data in memory in case of a system restart.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 7, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958283437, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The Redis application is built using an external library, [lib-redis](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-redis), that depends on other ported libraries for Unikraft ([pthread-embedded](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-pthread-embedded), [newlib](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-newlib) and [lwip](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-lwip) library), all of which you should be familiar with by now.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 8, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958283968, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
* `Makefile`: it contains rules for building the application, as well as specifying the external libraries that the application needs
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 8, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958284354, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![redis selection menu](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/redis_menu.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 9, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958284678, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
* `DHCP client`
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 9, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958284968, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![lwip selection menu](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/lwip_redis_menu.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 9, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958285715, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Thus, a filesystem should be selected in the configuration menu.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 10, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958286001, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The filesystem we previously used was 9PFS.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 10, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958287171, 'comment_body': "```suggestion

As such, in the `Library Configuration` section of the configuration menu, the following selection chain should be made in the vfscore library: `VFSCore Interface` -> `vfscore Configuration` -> `Automatically mount a root filesystem` -> `Default root filesystem` -> `9PFS`.
Same as before, since we'll be using the `qemu-guest` script, we'll need to name the `Default root device` `fs0` (`Library Configuration` -> `vfscore` -> `Default root device`).
```

Add a reminder that the `fs0` tag should be selected", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 12, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958290155, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
```

The script doesn't seem to do the stopping and deleting the settings for the network. Maybe we should delete this line? ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 14, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958290689, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
                -e ./redis_files \
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 15, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958290990, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![lwip selection menu](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/redis_setup.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 15, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958292506, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Consequently, after running the script, the Redis server will start and dnsmasq will act as a DHCP server and therefore it will dynamically assign to our Unikraft instance an IP address.
```
Point out that `dnsmasq` is a DHCP server?
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 17, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958297265, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
We aim to benchmark the Redis app running on top of Unikraft and Redis running on top of Linux.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 21, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958297980, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
First, we will start by benchmarking `app-redis` on Unikraft.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 22, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958298255, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Start Redis on top of Unikraft as we did before and in another terminal run the following command:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 22, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958298612, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The description of the used options can be seen here:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 23, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958299105, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The printed values represent `requests/second` for the `set` and `get` operations.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 23, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958299632, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The output should be similar to this:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 24, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958299848, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
The aim of this work item is to set up and run Nginx, a popular open-source web server.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 24, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958300385, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
From the point of view of the library dependencies, the Nginx app has the same dependencies as the Redis app. Of course, instead of `lib-redis`, the Nginx app depends on an external library called [lib-nginx](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-nginx). You can clone this library in the `libs/` directory in a similar manner as with the previous work items.
```
Add more details about Nginx?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 25, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958301329, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
![nginx output](/community/hackathons/sessions/complex-applications/images/nginx_output.png)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 26, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958301774, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Benchmarking Nginx running on top of Unikraft can be achieved with a utility called `iperf`.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 26, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958303040, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Next, we will start the nginx app as we have done with the previous work item, and then we will open two additional terminals.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 27, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958304183, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
In the second terminal, we'll start an `iperf` client by connecting to the Nginx server running on top of Unikraft with the command:
```

Point out that we are connecting to the nginx server and not the iperf server we've just launched", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 28, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958327036, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Following the steps above, the build of the entire system, together with the Redis application will be successful.
We can create a `redis_files` directory in which we can place our configuration file for Redis, `redis.conf`.
```
Maybe we can point out that a `redis_files` directory must be created?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 10, 53, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958558997, 'comment_body': "Not necessarily, it kills the dnsmasq process, so we shouldn't delete it completely.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 14, 29, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958585517, 'comment_body': 'Agree.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 14, 50, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'eduardvintila', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959422690, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Thanks to these features, SQLite is a fast, secure, and (most crucial) simple application.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 10, 28, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'craciunoiuc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959435445, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
We'll obtain a cpio archive called `archive.cpio` in the parent directory.
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 10, 44, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'craciunoiuc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959447430, 'comment_body': "I think it would be good to also have the `redis.conf` file here and use it. The unikraft version in the example used is `5.0.9` and the one in `redis-server` is `5.0.13`. I'm not sure if the default configuration changed between the results.

this is optional: most probably it doesn't affect the results that much", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 10, 59, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'craciunoiuc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959448239, 'comment_body': 'These values are pretty low and make unikraft look bad (compared to native linux :sweat_smile: )

Maybe we could try changing/running the example with initrd? 9pfs slows things down quite a bit', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 11, 0, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'craciunoiuc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959536185, 'comment_body': "Very nice observation! I'll provide the `redis.conf` file for this exercise as well.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 12, 42, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: hack/usoc22: Update session 05 - Contributing to Unikraft
pr_body:
Update the contents of sessions/contributing-to-unikraft.
Fix broken links created by the sessions migration and
add more information into the session content.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Jumarea <stefanjumarea02@gmail.com>
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 956771503, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Moving back to `libhogweed`, a practical example of the second case is the `run_all_libhogweed_tests(int v)` function from [`libhogweed/testutils_glue.c #674`](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-libhogweed/blob/staging/testutils_glue.c#L674), which calls every selected test module (we will see later how we can make selectable config variables) and returns `EXIT_SUCCESS` only if it passes over all the tests.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771513, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
1. Add compile flags, used, generally, for suppressing some compile warnings and making the build process neater:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771516, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
   There are situations when the test cases each have their own `main()` function.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771520, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
In general, this process is done by solving the issue on your personal fork of the project, and after that making a [pull request (PR)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/about-pull-requests) with your solution.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771524, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Remember to correctly include the library header.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771528, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Disable some tests, rebuild, and run the checker application again.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 28, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771534, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
From earlier sessions, we saw that we can add an external library as a dependency for an application by appending it to the `$LIBS` variable in the application's `Makefile`:
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 29, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771542, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
Having done that, we can then select it in the menuconfig interface in order for the library to be included in the build process.
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 29, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 956771546, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
* **external**: which mostly provide user space-level functionalities
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 28, 19, 29, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957097789, 'comment_body': 'This was ment to be
```
Remember to include the library header file.
```
not fine, thanks :)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 9, 37, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957441137, 'comment_body': "Wouldn't it be better if we suggested that if the users would like to keep the current working directory, they should only clone the unikraft core repo, without having to modify the app Makefile? 

Also, I suggest that we change the name of the `libhogweed` library to `lib-libhogweed` in order to maintain consistency with `lib-newlib`, which should also be cloned as part of this exercise.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 14, 49, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957441357, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
$ git clone https://github.com/unikraft/docs
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 14, 49, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957500846, 'comment_body': 'Hi @mariasfiraiala, thanks for pointing that out.
I would actually go the other way around to remove the inconsistency, renaming `lib-newlib` to `newlib` during the cloning process.
I think most of the students will be used to this naming convention by session 05 (`lib-name` on github being just `name/` locally and used as such in the build process), since it is used since the first session ([here](https://unikraft.org/community/hackathons/sessions/baby-steps/#03-tutorial-mount-9pfs) for example).
What do you think?

Also, the [`prepare.sh`](https://github.com/unikraft/docs/blob/main/content/en/community/hackathons/sessions/contributing-to-unikraft/sol/02-task-porting/prepare.sh#L10) scripts from `sol/` use the `newlib` name, so does the `lib-libhogweed` [readme file](https://github.com/unikraft/lib-libhogweed/blob/staging/README.md?plain=1#L8). ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 15, 41, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957579897, 'comment_body': "@StefanJum I don't really have a  tough stance regarding the naming convention, it's in my habits to not rename the files when cloning them.

Anyway, if we decide to go with names without `app-` or `lib-` as a prefix, I'll also need to update the session I am working on accordingly.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 16, 59, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957580583, 'comment_body': 'About my first suggestion, what are your thoughts?
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 17, 0, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957608260, 'comment_body': '@mariasfiraiala yes, the first suggestion is very on point, I will make an update for that.

About the naming conventions, I noticed that many parts of sessions down the road mix the names, only the first ones seem to be consistent, I guess after a while students realize the naming differences and just do their own.
I will make sure there is consistent naming throughout the entire session, no matter which convention it is.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 17, 23, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957687714, 'comment_body': "I suggest you provide a link for the 
>original library's README", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 18, 49, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957710921, 'comment_body': "Here, I'd give a snippet of how the output of a successful run of the app would look like.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 19, 18, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 957711563, 'comment_body': "I'd also hint at checking the `Config.uk` file for this task.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 29, 19, 19, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958006146, 'comment_body': "How would the `Config.uk` file help with configuration steps?
Is it about the requirement for `newlib`?
If so, I would add it [here](https://unikraft.org/community/hackathons/usoc22/contributing-to-unikraft/#08-intermediary-check), in the intermediary check section, since the file that will need changes is the app's `Makefile`.
", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 4, 58, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958015593, 'comment_body': 'There is a TODO_7 placed in `Config.uk` regarding adding `newlib` as a dependecy; it took me a while to discover that, because it wasn't specifically indicated to take a look into that file for the 7th task, I totally forgot about it:
```
# TODO_1
menuconfig LIBNAME
	bool "kdtree - simplify the use of kd-trees"
	default n
	# TODO_7
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 5, 18, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958017368, 'comment_body': "Oh I see, you're right, I will add that as a note.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 5, 22, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958685511, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
$ git clone https://github.com/unikraft/docs
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 16, 17, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958697520, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
**Note**: You can leave the application's `main()` function empty for now, the resulted unikernel will just print the `Unikraft` banner.
```

This had a very weird usage of backticks, I don't really know if it's intentional.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 16, 29, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mariasfiraiala', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 958851999, 'comment_body': 'Definitely not intentional :)
No idea how I missed it before, it messed up a lot of text, thank you.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 30, 19, 26, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'StefanJum', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 959608040, 'comment_body': 'The quiz should be after the practical work, and before the feedback form.

Also, maybe you can generate that shorter link to the form and change it here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 31, 13, 46, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'craciunoiuc', 'type': 'User'}]
